intro: Descurainia obtusa subsp. adenophora, commonly known as the腺花独行菜, is a flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, elongated leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in racemes, which are typically arranged along the upper part of the stem. It is native to parts of Asia and is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. The subspecies is distinguished by its glandular-pubescent stems and leaves, which give it a unique appearance.
